com.digev.fw.message

Class ResourceBundleMessageProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digev.fw.message.AbstractMessageSourceProvider
      • com.digev.fw.message.ResourceBundleMessageProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageSourceProvider

    public class ResourceBundleMessageProvider
extends AbstractMessageSourceProvider
    MessageSource that uses a ResourceBundle to retrieve message patterns and the MessageFormat text formatter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceBundleMessageProvider() 
      ResourceBundleMessageProvider(java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Constructs the message source with a ResourceBundle.
      ResourceBundleMessageProvider(java.lang.String baseName)
      Constructs the message source with the given base name for a file based resource bundle.

    • Method Detail

      • setLocaleName

      • setLocale

      • getPattern

        public java.lang.String getPattern(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: MessageSourceProvider
        Returns the pattern for the supplied key. A pattern is a message that has not been formatted with potential message arguments. The pattern can be used multiple times for the substitute() method if the user would like multiple versions of the same message but with different arguments.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the pattern to return.
        Returns:
        String pattern for the given key. It is important that if there is no pattern available, the implementation returns null. This allows higher level objects to determine if the implementation can satisfy a given key.

      • substitute

        public java.lang.String substitute(java.lang.String pattern,
                                   java.lang.Object[] arguments)
        Description copied from interface: MessageSourceProvider
        Returns a formatted message based on the given pattern using the supplied message arguments. The message is formatted by substituting placeholders (if any) in the pattern with the supplied arguments.
        Parameters:
        pattern - String pattern to format.
        arguments - Object array of arguments to substitute.
        Returns:
        String message formatted with the supplied arguments.

      • getLocale

        public java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Description copied from interface: MessageSourceProvider
        Returns the locale being used for the MessageSource.
        Returns:
        Locale of the MessageSource.
